intro: Micromeria teneriffae, commonly known as the Canary Island micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
